author: cnbc.com
title: WRAPUP 1-U.S. rise, but labor market tightening
text:
* Weekly jobless claims increase 11,000 to 234,000
* Four-week average of claims rise 6,250
* Continuing claims rebound 29,000
WASHINGTON, May 24 (Reuters) - continued to suggest that the labor market is tight.
 Economists polled by Reuters had forecast claims slipping to 220,000 in the latest week.
Claims have now been below the 300,000 mark, which is associated with a strong jobs market, for 168 straight weeks. That is the longest such stretch since 1969, according to the Labor Department. 17-1/2-year low of 3.9 percent.
The Tightening
U.S. financial markets were little moved by the claims data.
 at 4.1 percent for six straight months.
Shrinking labor market slack bolsters economists' expectations that wage growth will accelerate in the second half of the year. (Reporting by Lucia Mutikani Editing by Paul Simao and Chizu Nomiyama)
